sections.overview: Splitbeam is a specialist theatre and long-run rental partner, providing equipment rental, long-term leasing, and technical production support for theatres, schools, touring shows, and performance venues. It operates as part of the Gearhouse Group.
sections.what_delivers: Splitbeam delivers theatre-focused equipment rental, long-term leasing, and technical production services designed for environments where consistency, uptime, and specialist knowledge of performance spaces matter. It supports lighting, audio, rigging, and audiovisual requirements without the financial and operational burden of ownership. Its value is predictable delivery over time, with equipment that is maintained, available, and fit for theatre realities.
sections.how_it_fits: Splitbeam is the theatre and long-run rental specialist within the Gearhouse Group. Clients often engage Splitbeam for a specific theatre requirement, but the wider group enables a production to scale into larger venues, touring formats, broadcast environments, or multi-discipline delivery without adding new suppliers.
sections.decision_context: The decision is whether to own and maintain equipment internally or partner with a specialist who provides consistency, predictability, and technical continuity over time.

discovery_patterns.title: Industry familiarity and referrals
discovery_patterns.description: Splitbeam is most often discovered through theatre networks, schools, designers, and production professionals who trust specialist long-term rental support.

discovery_patterns.title: Problem-led search
discovery_patterns.description: Buyers arrive when short-term rentals become inefficient, availability is inconsistent, or lifecycle costs rise across a long-running production.

discovery_patterns.title: Peer validation
discovery_patterns.description: Reputation and prior delivery carry more weight than broad marketing. Buyers validate capability through trusted networks and proof of consistent delivery.

sections.how_buyers_find: Mostly through direct search and industry referrals.

priority_channels.action: Action: Add audience-specific entry points (theatres, schools, touring productions) and a clear consult CTA for long-term rental and technical support.
Action: Provide a simple ‘school and theatre rental pack’ that makes budgeting, uptime, and support terms easy to understand and share.
Action: Use it for credibility signals and proof, not volume lead generation.

target_audience.primary: Theatre professionals, venue managers, and schools responsible for long-run productions and consistent technical delivery.
target_audience.motivators: Buyers value predictability, budget stability, and technical continuity. They prioritise solutions that remove operational uncertainty over time.
validation_channels: Website validation for long-term rental confidence
target_audience.lead_quality: Leads convert through trust and relevance rather than broad visibility.

gaps_improvements.gap: Service-led copy without clear problem framing
gaps_improvements.impact: Visitors see 'equipment rental' but don't immediately grasp the strategic value of long-term partnership versus ad-hoc hire.
gaps_improvements.improvement_opportunity: Lead with the financial and operational benefits of long-term rental (predictability, maintenance, support).

gaps_improvements.impact: Schools, theatres, and touring productions have distinct needs. A generic homepage slows down their journey to relevance.
gaps_improvements.improvement_opportunity: Create distinct pathways for 'Schools', 'Theatres', and 'Touring Productions' to fast-track relevance.

gaps_improvements.gap: Gearhouse group strength is not explained
gaps_improvements.impact: Buyers might see Splitbeam as a standalone niche player, missing the scale and backup assurance provided by the wider group.
gaps_improvements.improvement_opportunity: Explicitly mention the Gearhouse Group backing to reassure buyers about scale, insurance, and backup capability.

gaps_improvements.gap: Long-term value not contrasted with short-term hire
gaps_improvements.impact: Price comparison against short-term rental rates can look unfavourable if the long-term value props (maintenance, swaps, support) aren't clear.
gaps_improvements.improvement_opportunity: Clearly articulate the 'Total Cost of Ownership' benefits of long-term rental vs buying or ad-hoc hiring.

sections.brand_limitations: Splitbeam should not chase high-volume, short-term rental demand outside its specialist focus. Its strength is long-run reliability, not transactional hire.
sections.performance_leakage: Site performance is hindering user retention.

lead_growth_recommendations.overview: Splitbeam’s growth is driven by clarity around long-term rental as a strategic alternative to ownership. Its audience values predictability, continuity, and technical confidence.
focus_areas: Reinforce long-term rental as an operational strategy
Deepen trust within theatre and education networks
lead_growth_recommendations.channel_copy: This messaging should live primarily within direct relationships, the website, and materials used to support long-term rental discussions. It should not rely on broad media. Copy should emphasise stability, budget predictability, and operational continuity, reinforcing trust rather than urgency.

broadbrand_intervention.constraint:
Splitbeam’s lead quality is strong, but discovery is heavily relationship-led and assumes prior understanding of long-term rental benefits.

This limits growth to existing networks and slows adoption among adjacent buyers experiencing the same operational pain.
broadbrand_intervention.intervention:
BroadBrand would help reframe Splitbeam’s offering around predictability, lifecycle cost control, and operational stability.

Messaging would contrast long-term rental against short-term hire, helping buyers self-identify earlier in the decision journey.

This would be done without expanding channels, focusing on clarity within existing validation touchpoints.
